page.title: 17GHOSTS AND TALES OF WYKE 2.
page.content: Shirley Manor House is also said to possess a ghost. The house was built in 1859 by John Taylor, a manufacturer and dyer of cloth. He sold the house to James Sharp, a factory owner from Bradford. One of Mr Sharp's daughters was not allowed to marry her lover, and as a result her spirit is still said to walk the upstairs of the house. Since then, the house has been converted into an old people's home and members of staff have sworn they have seen her walking around upstairs. A past warden of the house would know the identity of a resident who had just died before being informed of the passing. She said it was the spirit of the person coming to say goodbye to her because she had known them for a long time.
